message.content:
cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.SOC

Reasoning: The paper discusses the challenge of sorting through a flood of content in information-rich environments, which is a common problem in social media. The use of Twitter as a case study suggests a focus on social media platforms, which could fall under the sub-categories of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) or cs.SOC (Social and Societal Computing). The attention economy solution and algorithm used to select informative tweets suggest a focus on information retrieval (cs.IR) and data mining (cs.SD). Finally, the consideration of novelty and popularity as objective measures could also relate to the sub-category of cs.CY (Computers and Society).
